tit.e: Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry)
Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry)
Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry)

sen.j: 『古今和歌集』（こきんわかしゅう）とは初めての勅撰和歌集である。
sen.e: Kokin Wakashu was the first anthology of poems collected by Imperial command.
Kokin Wakashu was the first anthology of poems collected by Imperial command.
"Kokin Wakashu" was the first anthology of poems collected by Imperial command.
sen.cmt: 原文の『』に合せて" "補足しました。

sen.j: 醍醐天皇の勅命によって編まれ、平安時代の延喜5年（905年）に成立、同年4月18日 (旧暦)（5月29日）に醍醐天皇に奏上された。
sen.e: Compiled by the command of Emperor Daigo and completed in 905 during the Heian period, Kokin Wakashu was submitted to that emperor on May 29 of the same year.
Compiled by the command of Emperor Daigo and completed in 905 during the Heian period, Kokin Wakashu was submitted to the emperor on May 29 of the same year.
Compiled by the command of Emperor Daigo and completed in 905 during the Heian period, Kokin Wakashu was submitted to the emperor on May 29 of the same year.

sen.j: 『万葉集』から撰者らの時代までの140年間の名歌を集めている。
sen.e: Great poems over 140 years from times of Manyoshu to that of the compilers this anthology were collected.
Great poems over 140 years from times of Manyoshu to that of the compilers this anthology were collected.
Great poems over 140 years from times of "Manyoshu" to that of the compilers this anthology were collected.
sen.cmt: 原文の『』に合せて" "補足しました。

sen.j: 略称「古今集」。
sen.e: It is abbreviated to Kikinshu.
It was abbreviated to Kikinshu.
It was abbreviated to 'Kikinshu.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて' '補足しました。

sen.j: 真名序は紀淑望、仮名序は紀貫之が執筆した。
sen.e: The Chinese preface was written by KI no Yoshimochi, whereas, the Japanese preface was written by KI no Tsurayuki.
The Chinese preface was written by KI no Yoshimochi, whereas, the Japanese preface was written by KI no Tsurayuki.
The Chinese preface was written by KI no Yoshimochi, whereas, the Japanese preface was written by KI no Tsurayuki.

sen.j: 和歌集としてだけでなく、古今和歌集仮名序は後世に大きな影響を与えた歌論として文学的に重要である。
sen.e: The Japanese preface of Kokin Wakashu is of literary importance not only as a wakashu but also as a treatise on waka poetry that had a significant influence on Japanese poetry in the years to come.
The Japanese preface of Kokin Wakashu is of literary importance not only as a wakashu but also as a treatise on waka poetry that had a significant influence on Japanese poetry in the years to come.
The Japanese preface of Kokin Wakashu is of literary importance not only as a wakashu but also as a treatise on waka poetry that had a significant influence on Japanese poetry in the years to come.

sen.j: 天皇が勅命を出し国家事業として和歌集を編むという伝統を確立した書でもあり、八代集・二十一代集の第一に数えられる。
sen.e: Kokin Wakashu established the tradition of anthology of waka by Imperial command as a state project and it is recognized as the number one among Hachidaishu (the eight collections of history books by Imperial command") and Nijuichidai-shu (the twenty-one collections of waka compiled by imperial command).

Kokin Wakashu established the tradition of anthology of waka by Imperial command as a state project and it is recognized as the number one among Hachidaishu (the eight collections of history books by Imperial command") and Nijuichidai-shu (the twenty-one collections of waka compiled by imperial command).

Kokin Wakashu established the tradition of anthology of waka by Imperial command as a state project and it is recognized as the number one among Hachidaishu (the eight collections of history books by Imperial command) and Nijuichidai-shu (the twenty-one collections of waka compiled by imperial command).
sen.cmt: 不要な"を削除しました。

sen.j: 平安中期の国風文化確立にも大きく寄与し、『枕草子』では古今集を暗唱することが平安中期の貴族にとって教養とみなされたことが記されている。
sen.e: Kokin Wakashu made a significant contribution to establishing the Kokufu Bunka (Japan's original national culture) in the mid Heian period and, according to Makura no Soshi (the Pillow Book), it was considered a cultural accomplishment to recite Kokinshu among noblemen in those days.

Kokin Wakashu made a significant contribution to establishing the Kokufu Bunka (Japan's original national culture) in the mid Heian period and, according to Makura no Soshi (the Pillow Book), it was considered a cultural accomplishment to recite Kokinshu among noblemen in those days.

Kokin Wakashu made a significant contribution to establishing the Kokufu Bunka (Japan's original national culture) in the mid Heian period and, according to "Makura no Soshi" (the Pillow Book), it was considered a cultural accomplishment to recite Kokinshu among noblemen in those days.
sen.cmt: 原文の『』に合せて" "補足しました。

sen.j: 紀貫之
sen.e: KI no Tsurayuki
KI no Tsurayuki

sen.j: 紀友則（死亡）
sen.e: KI no Tomonori (deceased)

sen.j: 壬生忠岑
sen.e: MIBU no Tadamine

sen.j: 凡河内躬恒
sen.e: OSHIKOCHI no Mitsune
OSHIKOCHI no Mitsune

sen.j: 20巻で構成され、歌数は総勢1111首。
sen.e: Kokin Wakashu consists of 20 volumes with the number of poems totaling 1111.
Kokin Wakashu consists of 20 volumes with the number of poems totaling 1111.
Kokin Wakashu consists of 20 volumes with the number of poems totaling 1111.

sen.j: その中に長歌5首・旋頭歌4首を含む。
sen.e: Those poems include 5 long poems and 4 sedoka (an adjacent form of the waka or tanka which consists of six lines with sound units arranged as six/seven/seven, five/seven/seven).
Those poems include 5 long poems and 4 sedoka (an adjacent form of the waka or tanka which consists of six lines with sound units arranged as six/seven/seven, five/seven/seven).
Those poems include 5 long poems and 4 sedoka (an adjacent form of the waka or tanka which consists of six lines with sound units arranged as six/seven/seven, five/seven/seven).

sen.j: 残りはすべて短歌。
sen.e: The remainder is all tanka.
The remainder are all tanka.
The remainder are all tanka.

sen.j: 仮名序と真名序の2つの序文を持つ。
sen.e: There are 2 prefaces including kanajo (Japanese preface) and manajo (a preface written in Chinese).
There are 2 prefaces including kanajo (Japanese preface) and manajo (a preface written in Chinese).
There are 2 prefaces including kanajo (Japanese preface) and manajo (a preface written in Chinese).

sen.j: 内容はほぼ同じである。
sen.e: The contents of these 2 prefaces are virtually identical.
The contents of these 2 prefaces are virtually identical.
The contents of these 2 prefaces are virtually identical.

sen.j: 仮名序は紀貫之の筆。
sen.e: The Japanese preface was written by KI no Tsurayuki.
The Japanese preface was written by KI no Tsurayuki.
The Japanese preface was written by KI no Tsurayuki.

sen.j: 20巻からなる本文は春（上下巻）・夏・秋（上下巻）・冬・賀・離別・羇旅・物名・恋（1～5巻）・哀傷・雑・雑体・大歌所御歌に分類されている。
sen.e: The body of Kokin Wakashu consists of 20 volumes and has been organized into the classifications including Spring (2 volumes), Summer and Autumn (2 volumes), Winter, Congratulations, Partings, Travel, Acrostics, Love (5 volumes), Laments, Miscellaneous, Miscellaneous Forms and Traditional Poems.

The body of Kokin Wakashu consists of 20 volumes and has been organized into the classifications including Spring (2 volumes), Summer and Autumn (2 volumes), Winter, Congratulations, Partings, Travel, Acrostics, Love (5 volumes), Laments, Miscellaneous, Miscellaneous Forms and Traditional Poems.

The body of Kokin Wakashu consists of 20 volumes and has been organized into the classifications including Spring (2 volumes), Summer and Autumn (2 volumes), Winter, Congratulations, Partings, Travel, Acrostics, Love (5 volumes), Laments, Miscellaneous, Miscellaneous Forms and Traditional Poems.

sen.j: 古今和歌集で確立されたこの分類は和歌の分類の規範となり、歌会、歌論などにおいて使われた。
sen.e: This classification established by Kokin Wakashu became the standard method for organizing waka and was adopted at various waka events such as Uta-kai (poem competition) and treatise on waka poetry.
This classification established by Kokin Wakashu became the standard method for organizing waka and was adopted at various waka events such as Uta-kai (poem competition) and treatise on waka poetry.
This classification established by Kokin Wakashu became the standard method for organizing waka and was adopted at various waka events such as Uta-kai (poem competition) and treatise on waka poetry.

sen.j: さらに後世の勅撰和歌集に形を変えながら継承され、また連歌におけるさらに細分化された句の分類の基礎ともなった。
sen.e: This classification method, while going through various revisions, was passed down to the succeeding anthologies of waka by Imperial command and, furthermore, became the cornerstone of organizing renga which further segment zed poems.

This classification method, while going through various revisions, was passed down to the succeeding anthologies of waka by Imperial command and, furthermore, became the cornerstone of organizing renga which further segment zed poems.

This classification method, while going through various revisions, was passed down to the succeeding anthologies of waka by Imperial command and, furthermore, became the cornerstone of organizing renga which further segment zed poems.

sen.j: 巻十九冒頭に「短歌」という標目で長歌が収録されていることは、古来、謎とされてきたが、2000年に新しい説が提示された。
sen.e: Since ancient times, it had remained a mystery that choka (long poems) were included under the heading of 'Tanka' (short poems) in the beginning of Volume 19 but, in 2000, a new explanation was offered.

Since ancient times, it had remained a mystery that choka (long poems) were included under the heading of 'Tanka' (short poems) in the beginning of Volume 19 but, in 2000, a new explanation was offered.

Since ancient times, it had remained a mystery that choka (long poems) were included under the heading of 'Tanka' (short poems) in the beginning of Volume 19 but, in 2000, a new explanation was offered.
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。

sen.j: 繊細優美な作風でそこから『万葉集』の「ますらをぶり」と対比して「たをやめぶり」と呼ばれ、女性的とも言われる。
sen.e: The delicate style of poems of Kokin Wakashu is referred to as 'feminine' in contrast to the 'masculine' style of Manyoshu.
The delicate style of poems of Kokin Wakashu is referred to as 'feminine' in contrast to the 'masculine' style of Manyoshu.
The delicate style of poems of Kokin Wakashu is referred to as 'feminine' in contrast to the 'masculine' style of "Manyoshu."
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。原文の『』に合せて" "補足しました。

sen.j: 艶かしい姿態美を持つ。
sen.e: It has a coquettish beautiful body.
It has a coquettish beautiful body.
It has a coquettish beautiful body.

sen.j: また巧みな技巧が発達し、特に「掛詞（懸詞）」「縁語」が多用された。
sen.e: Sophisticated techniques developed and, particularly, kakekotoba (a rhetoric in Waka in which one word has more than one meaning) and engo (two words related in meaning, used in waka to heighten effect) were often used.

Sophisticated techniques developed and, particularly, kakekotoba (a rhetoric in Waka in which one word has more than one meaning) and engo (two words related in meaning, used in waka to heighten effect) were often used.

Sophisticated techniques developed and, particularly, 'kakekotoba' (a rhetoric in Waka in which one word has more than one meaning) and 'engo' (two words related in meaning, used in waka to heighten effect) were often used.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて' '補足しました。

sen.j: また、五七調から七五調への移り変わりがみられる。
sen.e: Additionally, a transition from the five-and-seven syllable meter to the seven-and-five syllable meter was detected.
Additionally, a transition from the five-and-seven syllable meter to the seven-and-five syllable meter was detected.
Additionally, a transition from the five-and-seven syllable meter to the seven-and-five syllable meter was detected.

tit.e: Kokin denju (the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems)
Kokin denju (the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems)
Kokin denju (the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems)

sen.j: 『古今和歌集』の歌風は後に伝承化され古今伝授（こきんでんじゅ）と称されるようになった。
sen.e: The style of Kokin Wakashu subsequently became a school of waka which was passed down to the succeeding generations being referred to as Kokin denju (the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems).

The style of Kokin Wakashu subsequently became a school of waka which was passed down to the succeeding generations being referred to as Kokin denju (the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems).

The style of "Kokin Wakashu" subsequently became a school of waka which was passed down to the succeeding generations being referred to as Kokin denju (the secret transmissions of the "Kokinshu," Anthology of Old and New Japanese Poems).
sen.cmt: 原文の『』に合せて" "補足しました。全角のスペースを半角にしました。

sen.j: 以後、宮廷を中心とする御所伝授や地下伝授・堺伝授などの系統が形成されていった。
sen.e: Thereafter, other various schools of waka including Goshodenju (the instruction of knowledge on Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry in the Imperial Palace) which was instructed in and around the Imperial Palace, Chika denju (a school of the interpretation of Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) and Sakai denju (a school of the interpretation of Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) developed.

Thereafter, other various schools of waka including Goshodenju (the instruction of knowledge on Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry in the Imperial Palace) which was instructed in and around the Imperial Palace, Chika denju (a school of the interpretation of Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) and Sakai denju (a school of the interpretation of Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) developed.

Thereafter, other various schools of waka including Goshodenju (the instruction of knowledge on Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry in the Imperial Palace) which was instructed in and around the Imperial Palace, Chika denju (a school of the interpretation of Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) and Sakai denju (a school of the interpretation of Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) developed.

sen.j: また細川幽斎が三条西実枝から承継し、戦国の処世術としても用いた古今伝授は実際には「この歌に詠まれている木は、何処の木」といった由来に関する内容のものであったという（富士正晴の研究に依る）。
sen.e: It was said that, Kokin denju, which Yusai HOSOKAWA inherited from Sankei SANJONISHI even relied on for the art of getting along with people during the Sengoku period, was about nothing but explaining where the trees mentioned in the poems existed (based on the study conducted by Masaharu FUJI).

It was said that, Kokin denju, which Yusai HOSOKAWA inherited from Sankei SANJONISHI even relied on for the art of getting along with people during the Sengoku period, was about nothing but explaining where the trees mentioned in the poems existed (based on the study conducted by Masaharu FUJI).

It was said that, Kokin denju, which Yusai HOSOKAWA inherited from Sankei SANJONISHI even relied on for the art of getting along with people during the Sengoku period, was about nothing but explaining where the trees mentioned in the poems existed (based on the study conducted by Masaharu FUJI).

sen.j: 本居宣長は『排蘆小船』で、これを後代の捏造であると痛烈に批判している。
sen.e: In Ashiwakeobune (treatise on waka poetry), Norinaga MOTOORI made a blistering criticism that it was a fabricated account made in posterity.
In Ashiwakeobune (treatise on waka poetry), Norinaga MOTOORI made a blistering criticism that it was a fabricated account made in posterity.
